channel.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“UniqueTrys, post:30, topic:410167”]Imsuperman, I have that at the saving (where it’s supposed to be) the error is in the loading (where I did put the right code but I think it’s with a { on the wrong place or whatever)

Apply deadVoid

public class PlayerAssistant{ public boolean teleTabTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType){ if(c.Jail == true){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.duelStatus == 5){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport during a duel!"); } else if(c.inFightCaves()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!"); } else if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport above level "+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+" in the wilderness."); } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength){ c.sendMessage("You are teleblocked and can't teleport."); } else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){ if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0) c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack(); c.stopMovement(); removeAllWindows(); c.teleX = x; c.teleY = y; c.npcIndex = 0; c.playerIndex = 0; c.faceUpdate(0); c.teleHeight = height; if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("teleTab")) { c.startAnimation(9597); c.teleEndAnimation = 11973; c.teleTimer = 8; c.gfx0(1680); } return true; } return false; }

can’t show playersave.java don’t have space in the post[/quote]

wtf is that?
thats not your applydead void

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @UniqueTrys UniqueTrys
item.description:
@UniqueTrys wrote:

Imsuperman, I have that at the saving (where it’s supposed to be) the error is in the loading (where I did put the right code but I think it’s with a { on the wrong place or whatever)

Apply deadVoid

public class PlayerAssistant{ public boolean teleTabTeleport(int x, int y, int height, String teleportType){ if(c.Jail == true){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.inJail() && c.Jail == true) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of Jail!"); } else if(c.duelStatus == 5){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport during a duel!"); } else if(c.inFightCaves()) { c.sendMessage("You can't teleport out of this minigame!"); } else if(c.inWild() && c.wildLevel > Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL){ c.sendMessage("You can't teleport above level "+Config.NO_TELEPORT_WILD_LEVEL+" in the wilderness."); } else if(System.currentTimeMillis() - c.teleBlockDelay < c.teleBlockLength){ c.sendMessage("You are teleblocked and can't teleport."); } else if(!c.isDead && c.teleTimer == 0 && c.respawnTimer == -6){ if (c.playerIndex > 0 || c.npcIndex > 0) c.getCombat().resetPlayerAttack(); c.stopMovement(); removeAllWindows(); c.teleX = x; c.teleY = y; c.npcIndex = 0; c.playerIndex = 0; c.faceUpdate(0); c.teleHeight = height; if(teleportType.equalsIgnoreCase("teleTab")) { c.startAnimation(9597); c.teleEndAnimation = 11973; c.teleTimer = 8; c.gfx0(1680); } return true; } return false; }

can’t show playersave.java don’t have space in the post

You didn’t add it right… Should be

for(int j = 0; j < p.lastKilledPlayers.size(); j++) { characterfile.write("killed-players = ", 0, 17); characterfile.write(p.lastKilledPlayers.get(j), 0, p.lastKilledPlayers.get(j).length()); characterfile.newLine(); }

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @UniqueTrys UniqueTrys
item.description:
@UniqueTrys wrote:

The PlayerAssistant.java you send me didn’t work I mean the PkPoint system works but you can still farm points this way… Look:

2cfpok0.png721×478

However, I did start on the tutorial you also sent me but when I was done I got the error (i think its a pretty easy fix but haven’t found how to yet) maybe you know it:

src\server\model\players\PlayerKilling.java:49: error: class, interface, or enum expected package server.model.players; ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerSave.java:80: error: 'else' without 'if' } else if(token.equals("killed-players") ) { ^ 2 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I think the problem is here:

} else if (token.equals("character-rights")) { p.playerRights = Integer.parseInt(token2); for(int j = 0; j < p.lastKilledPlayers.size(); j++) { } else if(token.equals("killed-players")) { p.lastKilledPlayers.add(token2); }

Just don’t know how to fix it.

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

If you read he said he wanted it so the person who dies loses 1 pk point and the person who kills them gets 5 pk points. He also wants to make it so that if you kill a player twice in a row then you won’t get pk points.

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Why do you guys keep adding c.pkpoints -= 1;??? I don’t think he said he wanted that… You don’t have to redo the whole method, just change it to o.pkpoints += 5; There was a release on lame r-S, relevant to pk points.

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

K just fixed it and tested it…

Replace everything in

with

[code=java]
public void applyDead() {
c.respawnTimer = 10;
c.isDead = false;
if(c.duelStatus != 6) {

        c.killerId = findKiller();
        Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
        if(o != null) {
		c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
		}
		
		if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
				o.duelStatus++;
			}
            if(!(c.npcIndex > 0) && c.inPits == false){
            if (c.killerId != c.playerId)
                o.sendMessage("You have defeated "+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+"!");
				if( c.killerId != c.playerId && Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && !c.inWild()){
                                    c.sendMessage("You have lost one of your precious Pk Points because you died!");

o.pkPoints += 5;
c.pkPoints -= 1;
c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
}
o.lastKilled = Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom;
} else {
o.sendMessage(“You have already killed” +c.playerName+ " twice in a row.");
}
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

try this

[code=java]public void applyDead() {
c.respawnTimer = 10;
c.isDead = false;
if(c.duelStatus != 6) {
//c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId);
c.killerId = findKiller();
Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId];
if(o != null) {
if(!(c.npcIndex > 0) && c.inPits == false){
}
if (c.killerId != c.playerId)
o.sendMessage(“You have defeated “+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+”!”);
}
}
}
if(Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && c.duelStatus == 0 && !c.inWild()){
c.sendMessage(“You have lost one of your precious Pk Points because you died!”);
o.pkPoints += 5;
c.pkPoints -= 1;
o.lastKilled = Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom;
o.sendMessage(“You have received 5 Pk Points after defeating “+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+”!”);
else {
o.sendMessage(“You have to kill another player, you’ve killed this person twice in a row”);
}
}

c.playerKilled = c.playerId;
if(o.duelStatus == 5) {
o.duelStatus++;
}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @owner_ryan2 owner_ryan
item.description:
@owner_ryan2 wrote:

public void applyDead() { c.respawnTimer = 15; c.isDead = false; Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId]; if(c.duelStatus != 6) { c.killerId = findKiller(); if(o != null) { c.playerKilled = c.playerId; if(o.duelStatus == 5) { o.duelStatus++; } if (Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom != o.lastKilled && c.duelStatus == 0) { o.pkPoints = (o.pkPoints + 4); o.sendMessage("You recieved 4 pkPoints"); o.lastKilled = Server.playerHandler.players[c.playerId].connectedFrom; } else { o.sendMessage("You do not recieve pk points because you have killed " +c.playerName+ " twice in a row."); } } }

That is in my Player Assist and it works fine :]

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Pk Points System is BAD
item.dc:creator: @UniqueTrys UniqueTrys
item.description:
@UniqueTrys wrote:

Alright guys, I did that looks now like this:

public void applyDead() { c.respawnTimer = 10; c.isDead = false; if(c.duelStatus != 6) { //c.killerId = c.getCombat().getKillerId(c.playerId); c.killerId = findKiller(); Client o = (Client) Server.playerHandler.players[c.killerId]; if(o != null) { if(!(c.npcIndex > 0) && c.inPits == false){ } if (c.killerId != c.playerId) o.sendMessage("You have defeated "+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+"!"); if(c.inWild()){ c.pkPoints -= 1; c.sendMessage("You have lost one of your precious Pk Points because you died!"); o.pkPoints += 5; o.sendMessage("You have received 5 Pk Points after defeating "+Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName)+"!"); } c.playerKilled = c.playerId; if(o.duelStatus == 5) { o.duelStatus++; } } }

But it doesn’t make any difference to what I’m trying to do. It doesn’t make you NOT get any points if you kill the same person, which is the goal.

Look: the points just keep coming.
